newsitem.title: USA: Mentor sees Q3 revs, earnings below yr ago.
newsitem.headline: Mentor sees Q3 revs, earnings below yr ago.

text.p: Mentor Graphics Corp said on Wednesday that it expects delayed customer purchases to send third quarter revenues below year ago levels and net income to slightly above break even.
One year ago, the maker of electronic design automation software, earned $0.19 a share, or $12.4 million in net income, on sales of $107.4 million.
Analysts had forecast the company would earn $0.24 a share in the third quarter, according to First Call.
"The current order and revenue pace leads us to anticipate a single digit year-over-year percentage decline in revenue this quarter," Walden Rhines, chief executive officer said in a statement.
Mentor Graphics believes the current situation could affect earnings for "the next quarter or two.

Based on current information, Mentor Graphics said much of its revenue decline stems from "customers delaying purchases". Aggravating the problem is a decline in the value of Japanese yen versus the dollar.
